TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ManifestKinds extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the type of manifest that the signature information applies to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration has two purposes:
- In the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation.VerifySignature%2A> method, it specifies which manifests you want to generate signature information for.
- In a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation> object, it shows you which manifest the signature information is generated from.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.ManifestKinds Application = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The manifest is for an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.ManifestKinds ApplicationAndDeployment = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The manifest is for deployment and application. The is the default value for verifying signatures.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.ManifestKinds Deployment = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The manifest is for deployment only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.ManifestKinds None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The manifest is of no particular type.
